senses.sense_definition: To describe, name, or label someone or something using a specific epithet or descriptive phrase.

examples.text: Historians often <w>epithetize</w> the monarch as "The Great" due to his extensive conquests.
The journalist chose to <w>epithetize</w> the movement as a "silent revolution" in her article.

senses.sense_definition: To criticize, disparage, or insult someone by applying a derogatory label or name.

examples.text: It is unfair to <w>epithetize</w> the entire group based on the actions of a few individuals.
The campaign tried to <w>epithetize</w> the candidate as weak, but the strategy failed.
